text: War tax due stamp is a kind of war tax and postage due stamps that was used for mail when the war tax has not been paid by the sender. They were issued in Romania between 1915 and 1921. During war the sender of a letter paid a war tax. Then they placed a war tax stamp on the letter showing the tax was paid. If the sender did not do that, a war tax due stamp was applied by the postal service. When the letter was delivered the person receiving the letter paid double the normal rate. == Related pages == * Postage stamp * Stamp Act * Tax == References == Category:1910s in Europe Category:1920s in Europe Category:20th century in Romania Category:Postage stamps Category:Postal history Category:Taxation Category:War Category:World War I
